WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
 
I'm having issue when I want to load an Excel template, put some values in the sheet, and save changes.
Changes are made, but some results of formulas make a "#VALUE!" error. However I just have to click on the formula and press Enter to force recalculation and the error disappears.  This is quite annoying for my project which automatically generates Excel files from a template and publishes it.
 
Here is my code : 
$objPHPExcel = PHPExcel_IOFactory::load($file_in);
$objWriter = PHPExcel_IOFactory::createWriter($objPHPExcel, "Excel5");
$objWriter->save($file_out);
 
As you can see, even if I don't do anything else than saving, "file_in" is correct but "file_out" got #VALUE! error on most of the cells which contains formulas.
It's the same with different Excel format (Excel5 in/Excel2007 out, Excel2007 in/Excel5 out).
Working with Office 2003 and official patch for reading 2007 files.
See attached file for template concerned.
 
 
Sorry for bad English, i'm French.
WorkItem.Summary: Value Error while generating Excel files from templates
